item.description: Elastic Material Spring (material) regains its original shape after the removal of weight Plastic Material Plastic material can not regain its original shape after the weight is removed Force extension graph !
Equilibrium Clockwise moment = Anti Clockwise moment ![[Pasted image 20220809220653.png]] ignore the 450N under the boy for this example
Impulse Impulse = [[Force]] x [[Measurements#Measuring Time |Time]] SI Unit = Ns 1 A force can change motion and direction of an object.
Moment (or) Turning effect Moment = [[Force]] x Distance SI Unit = Nm $$M = F \cdot D$$ ![[Pasted image 20220809215944.

Momentum Momentum (p)= [[Mass]] x [[Velocity]] SI Unit = Kg m/s Only moving objects have momentum If an object is not moving it’s in rest therefore its momentum will be 0 Example Find the momentum of a ball rolling with the velocity of 20 m/s and mass of 0.

Pressure (1st Method) SI Unit = N/m3 (or) Pascal (Pa) Pressure can be measure by ‘manometer’ Manometer is a small U-shaped tube holding small amount of liquid $$P = ρ \cdot g\cdot h$$ $$ρ = \frac{M}{V}$$
Springs Extension (∆X) SI Unit = m Increase in length of spring after it is loaded by [[Mass]] !
